greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of endofunctions f on [n] such that f^k(i) = f(i) for all i in [n]; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
formula: A(n,k) = n! * [x^n] exp(Sum_{d|(k-1)} (x*exp(x))^d/d) for k>1, A(n,0)=1, A(n,1)=n^n.
maple: exp(add((x*exp(x))^d/d, d=divisors(k-1))), x, n+1), x, n))):
mathematica: A[0, 1] = 1; A[n_, k_] := If[k==0, 1, If[k==1, n^n, n!*SeriesCoefficient[ Exp[ DivisorSum[k-1, (x*Exp[x])^#/#&]], {x, 0, n}]]]; Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 20 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 24 2014
